reviewText: This DVD is a must have for any big Avril fan. However, the vocals are nowhere near her best. The concert is rather boring, she mostly just stands, runs, or jumps up and down on stage. As a show, the DVD is not her most entertaining. The concert probably gets 3 stars and the DVD gets an extra 2 for all the bonus features. It includes all of Avril's Let Go era music videos, a 40 minute behind the scenes look at the tour, a blooper reel, and photos. The DVD is worth adding to your collection if you're a hardcore fan and worth getting for the bonus features, but if you are interested in a good quality show with entertainment value, check out The Best Damn Tour: Live in Toronto instead.

Title: N/A

reviewText: Show-3 starsExtras/Bonus CD-4.5 starsOverall-3.75 starsThe back of this DVD screams "Avril like she's never been seen before", and while that may be true, it's still nothing to write home about. Don't get me wrong, I like Avril Lavigne just as much as the next person but this performance is just above being mediocre. Sure all the energy that makes a show great is there, she sounds good through about 3/4 of the concert and the band sounds like they do on the CD. Why the meager rating then? As much as I like Let Go I don't think that gave her grounds to release a concert in which she plays pretty much every song on it. There's songs I'm just flat out sick of by now so I don't really want to see them played live. However, Losing Grip, amazing.The real reason to buy this is for the bonus CD. I personally liked her rendition of the Metallica great Fuel simply because it was so different from the original. Also, one of my favorite Avril songs is included, Knockin' On Heaven's Door. Performed acoustically, Avril's voice has never sounded more pristine and sincere. The DVD extras aren't too shabby either. The videos, minus Sk8er Boi, are pretty good and the inclusion of Knockin' only impressed me more. And the behind-the-scenes will be fun for any fan to see.Basically if you like Avril enough to buy a CD of hers you'll like this as well. While the show isn't particularly mind-blowing the CD and extras more than make up for it. So yeah, if you can find it cheap (12.99 isn't bad but I found it for 6.99 so just keep an eye out) then by all means check it out.
Title: N/A

reviewText: First of all, I'd like to point out that this is a product, don't write reviews about what you think it'll be like, or whether or not you like the artist, ok, that's really not rating the product.Secondly, I'm gonna go over the whole dvd & what it consists. The DVD part of My World consists of a her live performance Try To Shut Me Up Tour in Buffalo NY. She plays 16 songs in this order:1. Sk8er Boi2. Nobody's Fool3. Mobile4. Anything But Ordinary5. Losing Grip6. Naked7. Too Much to Ask8. I Don't Give9. Basket Case(Green Day cover)10. My World11. I'm With You12. Complicated13. Unwanted14. Tomorrow15. Knockin' On Heavens Door16. Thing's I'll Never SayShe plays Mobile, Naked & Thing's I'll Never Say on electric guitar & Tomorrow on acoustic. Evan solos while Avril sings on Knockin' On Heavens Door, & they both play acoustic for Tomorrow & Avril obviously sings it. Avril's Cut is the behind-scenes featurette with features of Sk8er Boi, Japan, Losing Grip, Fuel, Complicated & more. Outtakes is a bunch of funny things they do, like going on a Roller Coaster with a crazy guy, brushing Avril's teeth, etc. 5 Music Videos including: Complicated, Sk8er Boi, I'm With You, Losing Grip & Knockin' On Heavens Door. A Photo Gallery consisting 28 photos, live pictures from her performances, very nifty. Gear includes pics of her shirts, keychains, a poster, etc. & message about joining her club, that's it.Third & last, it's the 6 song CD consisting of her performances of: Fuel(on MTV icon), Basket Case(live), Unwanted(live), Sk8er Boi(live), Knockin' On Heavens Door(live) & includes the song Why, which is featured on the Complicated single.It's a great buy, any Avril fans should enjoy it! As you know she doesn't lip synch any of her songs, she is awesome live, they edited the performance a bit, like the screening part & it's amazing the effects they added, it's truly an awesome performance. I felt like I was there, Thing's I'll Never Say was an awesome way to end the performance, probably the best song she performed, & my favourite off the album. GO & GET IT NOW!! I command you too. No I don't, it's great, buy it.

reviewText: There are billions of reasons of why does this DVD is great. 1st of all, i already have it and I will tell you that she performs all of the songs from "Let Go", a song called "I Don't Give", the Green Day's song "Basketcase", and a beautiful song called "Knockin' On Heaven's Door". This DVD has all the necesary to be a success!!! You won't be dissapointed, and in the outtakes, Avril tells some histories about herself, and some of them are really funny...so you will enjoy the concert and the music videos (Complicated, Sk8er Boi, I'm With You, Knockin' On Heaven's Door and Losing Grip), and you will laugh with her histories. Buy it now! Oh, and the song "Why" from the Bonus CD is really good, so don't be afraid about the new songs and videos that it has, just get it, because it's great and all of Avril's fans will love it; and the people that isn't an Avril's fan, will become one!. That is all I can tell you now about it. Bye.

reviewText: Avril Lavigne fans will like this DVD, i think the only thing a few Avril Lavigne fans will frown on is the fact that it's not DVD+CD, well it is, but the CD only has 4 or 5 songs, some aren't even from the DVD. Most live albums are DVD and CD. You do get some behind the scene footage, which doesn't add much to the DVD, but definitely is fun to watch from time to time. Overall, average, but a bit lacking, i think a lot more behind the scene footage could have been great for this DVD.

reviewText: I have this DVD and it's a great deal. You get a brief on the road documentary of Avril on her first tour; you also get a complete performance from one of her concerts featuring all the songs on the first album (and then some). It's obvious to anyone objective that Avril's singing wasn't very good when she first came out. However, I recently caught a performance of her from Mad TV, singing my favorite song from her second CD. I have to say it was incredible. It's obvious that she has put the time in to her craft and is turning into a phenomenal artist. Given how phenomenal she is now, I dont understand why her record company hasnt released a new DVD....
summary: Why isnt there a new live DVD?

reviewText: I have had the incredible opportunity to attend the "Try To Shut Me Up" tour in 2003 in St. Paul, MN. It was an absolutely incredible show. Avril was so incredible and the band was just amazing. I almost found myself in tears at this show because I am such a huge Avril fan and I was so happy to be there! This DVD helped me re-live my incredible experience at this show. I love to watch this awesome concert and bring back my memories. The special features are a lot of fun to watch as well. I recommend any Avril Lavigne fan to not hesitate to purchase this DVD immediately.
summary: A must for any Avril Lavigne fan!

reviewText: A product is produced and the production is really kind of poor.  The purpose of this product is to showcase someone's talents and her talents are kind of poor.  Some of the songs done are great songs and thats where the 3 stars come into play.  Now if you want me to just rate the DVD product I would have to give it 5 stars as the DVD works and is a wonderful invention.  Other then that this product is another recording industry deception.  The playing is sub par, the singing is sub par, the theatrics again sub par.  The only reason this girl has a recording contract is because they needed a Britney Spears for the teen grunge pop genre.  I would have given it less starts, but the DVD works and some of the actual songs used to be good before being torn apart by Avril.

reviewText: Avril Lavigne has a unique style, combining pop and rock. She's not really either one. She's definitely not a bubblegum pop princess, like Hilary Duff and such, but she's not a real rocker, like bands like Evanescence and Seether. She sounds very different live, kind of even more tomboyish, but I like it. She's a punky, spunky girl, and not afraid to get dirty. A nice change from the regular Britney and her clones. Also, unlike on her album, LET GO, there is some EMOTION there when she sings. And that's very important. You have to have passion to make music, and Avril does when you listen to her in MY WORLD.
summary: Avril not your average pop princess
Title: N/A

reviewText: What a great DVD! I've never seen an Avril Lavigne concert before buying this DVD, but now I can't wait for her to tour again, because she's great. She sings live throughout, and puts on an excellent performance. Even more amazing when you consider that she's still a teenager!. The concert is filled with energy, and you'll soon be cranking up the volume on your tv. Of course it helps that the only album's worth of material she has out, is brilliant to start off with. There are no "fillers" on the "Let go" album, so not surprisingly Avril performs the entire album here. All of your favorites are here, from the massive hit "Complicated" to an acoustic version of "Tomorrow". On top of the album tracks, there are also some more great songs, including "I don't give", "Knockin' on heaven's door" and a fantastic cover of Green Day's hit "Basketcase". The concert lasts for about 70 minutes, is a sheer joy to watch from start to finish.As if that wasn't enough, there are also some other awesome extras that make this a must-have DVD!. Firstly you get all of Avril's music videos, a great 40 min (approx) behind-the-scenes documentary following her around on tour, some outtakes, a photo gallery, AND a 6-track audio cd!. What more could you ask for?.This DVD/CD release is amazing value for money. Its great that Arista have put everything a fan could want onto one DVD, rather than trying to make more money by releasing the music videos separately on another DVD or something. For me this is worth the money just for the concert itself, so everything else is a great bonus. With a superb debut album and now DVD under her belt, I can't wait for Avril's next album.
summary: One of my fave music dvd's

reviewText: I think Avril is great, I saw her show live from this "Try to shut me up tour" from the front row at Nassau Colliseum in New York this past May.  As a recovering, now former Britney Spears fan it's great to see a show where the artist can sing and energize a crowd the way Avril can.  this DVD captures her live performance very well and it's a great way to revisit the memory of her live performance anytime I want to.  She is blunt and rough around the edges, but that only adds to her appeal, I think.  Avril is who she is and does not apologize for it, but I must say  Avril you will get a pot belly from drinking all that beer.  :0)
summary: I'm very happy with this DVD.  I recommend it to anyone!!!!

reviewText: I just finished watching this dvd and this is my review for each section...Try to Shut Me Up Tour, Buffalo NY concert (1 hour 10 minutes) - Sk8er Boi, Nobody's Fool, Mobile, Anything But Ordinary, Losing Grip, Naked, Too Much to Ask, I Don't Give, Basket Case(Green Day cover), My World, I'm With You, Complicated, Unwanted, Tomorrow, Knockin' On Heavens Door, Thing's I'll Never Say...In the performance of Complicated, Avril got two people from the audience to come onstage and sing with her. The only embarassing thing about that was when Avril let them take over the mic for a few seconds. Half of the time they didn't know the lyrics, or sang bad.Avril's cut - A few songs taken from the Tour featuring outtakes of the before and after effect ~ FUNNY!!!!Music videos - Complicated, I'm With You, Losing Grip, Sk8er Boy, Knockin' On Heaven's Door.Outtakes - Here is your chance to check out Avril and her band and see what they're like.Photo gallery - pictures of Avril and her band, and of her in concert.Backbone - If you want to be a member of Avril's fan club (your key to everything-Avril) go to [...]Gear - Sweatshirts, key chains, t-shirts, etc...(to purchase items go on site above [or avril-lavigne.com])There is a cd that is included with 6 songs live and "Why" from the Complicated single.I recommend Avril Lavigne - My World (DVD & CD) to anyone who is a fan of hers. Even if you're not, you'll still enjoy it.One more thing, Avril Lavigne [and her band] are great jumpers!!!!!!
